member.summary: Exact numeric value with precision 19 (if signed) or 20 (if unsigned) and scale 0 (signed: –2[63] <= n <= 2[63] – 1, unsigned:0 <= n <= 2[64] – 1) (SQL_BIGINT). This maps to .

member.name: F:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType.Binary
member.summary: A stream of binary data (SQL_BINARY). This maps to an of type .

member.name: F:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType.Bit
member.summary: Single bit binary data (SQL_BIT). This maps to .

member.name: F:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType.Char
member.summary: A fixed-length character string (SQL_CHAR). This maps to .

member.name: F:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType.Date
member.summary: Date data in the format yyyymmdd (SQL_TYPE_DATE). This maps to .

member.name: F:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType.DateTime
member.summary: Date data in the format yyyymmddhhmmss (SQL_TYPE_TIMESTAMP). This maps to .

member.name: F:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType.Decimal
member.summary: Signed, exact, numeric value with a precision of at least p and scale s, where 1 <= p <= 15 and s <= p. The maximum precision is driver-specific (SQL_DECIMAL). This maps to .

member.name: F:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType.Double
member.summary: Signed, approximate, numeric value with a binary precision 53 (zero or absolute value 10[–308] to 10[308]) (SQL_DOUBLE). This maps to .

member.name: F:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType.Image
member.summary: Variable length binary data. Maximum length is data source–dependent (SQL_LONGVARBINARY). This maps to an of type .

member.name: F:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType.Int
member.summary: Exact numeric value with precision 10 and scale 0 (signed: –2[31] <= n <= 2[31] – 1, unsigned:0 <= n <= 2[32] – 1) (SQL_INTEGER). This maps to .

member.name: F:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType.NChar
member.summary: Unicode character string of fixed string length (SQL_WCHAR). This maps to .

member.name: F:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType.NText
member.summary: Unicode variable-length character data. Maximum length is data source–dependent. (SQL_WLONGVARCHAR). This maps to .

member.name: F:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType.Numeric
member.summary: Signed, exact, numeric value with a precision p and scale s, where 1 <= p <= 15, and s <= p (SQL_NUMERIC). This maps to .

member.name: F:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType.NVarChar
member.summary: A variable-length stream of Unicode characters (SQL_WVARCHAR). This maps to .

member.name: F:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType.Real
member.summary: Signed, approximate, numeric value with a binary precision 24 (zero or absolute value 10[–38] to 10[38]).(SQL_REAL). This maps to .

member.name: F:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType.SmallDateTime
member.summary: Data and time data in the format yyyymmddhhmmss (SQL_TYPE_TIMESTAMP). This maps to .

member.name: F:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType.SmallInt
member.summary: Exact numeric value with precision 5 and scale 0 (signed: –32,768 <= n <= 32,767, unsigned: 0 <= n <= 65,535) (SQL_SMALLINT). This maps to .

member.name: F:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType.Text
member.summary: Variable length character data. Maximum length is data source–dependent (SQL_LONGVARCHAR). This maps to .

member.name: F:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType.Time
member.summary: Date data in the format hhmmss (SQL_TYPE_TIMES). This maps to .

member.name: F:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType.Timestamp
member.summary: A stream of binary data (SQL_BINARY). This maps to an of type .

member.name: M:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcCommandBuilder.QuoteIdentifier(System.String)
member.summary: Given an unquoted identifier in the correct catalog case, returns the correct quoted form of that identifier. This includes correctly escaping any embedded quotes in the identifier.
member.returns: The quoted version of the identifier. Embedded quotes within the identifier are correctly escaped.

member.name: M:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcCommandBuilder.QuoteIdentifier(System.String,System.Data.Odbc.OdbcConnection)
member.summary: Given an unquoted identifier in the correct catalog case, returns the correct quoted form of that identifier. This includes correctly escaping any embedded quotes in the identifier.
member.param: When a connection is passed, causes the managed wrapper to get the quote character from the ODBC driver, calling SQLGetInfo(SQL_IDENTIFIER_QUOTE_CHAR). When no connection is passed, the string is quoted using values from and .
member.returns: The quoted version of the identifier. Embedded quotes within the identifier are correctly escaped.

member.name: M:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcCommandBuilder.UnquoteIdentifier(System.String)
member.summary: Given a quoted identifier, returns the correct unquoted form of that identifier, including correctly unescaping any embedded quotes in the identifier.
member.param: The identifier that will have its embedded quotes removed.
member.returns: The unquoted identifier, with embedded quotes correctly unescaped.

member.name: M:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcCommandBuilder.UnquoteIdentifier(System.String,System.Data.Odbc.OdbcConnection)
member.summary: Given a quoted identifier, returns the correct unquoted form of that identifier, including correctly unescaping any embedded quotes in the identifier.
member.param: The identifier that will have its embedded quotes removed.
member.returns: The unquoted identifier, with embedded quotes correctly unescaped.

member.summary: Starts a transaction at the data source.
member.returns: An object representing the new transaction.
member.exception: A transaction is currently active. Parallel transactions are not supported.

member.name: M:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcConnection.BeginTransaction(System.Data.IsolationLevel)
member.summary: Starts a transaction at the data source with the specified value.
member.param: The transaction isolation level for this connection. If you do not specify an isolation level, the default isolation level for the driver is used.
member.returns: An object representing the new transaction.
member.exception: A transaction is currently active. Parallel transactions are not supported.

member.name: M:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcConnection.ChangeDatabase(System.String)
member.summary: Changes the current database associated with an open .
member.exception: The database name is not valid.
The connection is not open.
Cannot change the database.

member.summary: Closes the connection to the data source.

member.name: P:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcConnection.ConnectionString
member.summary: Gets or sets the string used to open a data source.
